reviews.review: This is TRUE masterpiece, Bravo! no more words. Thank you

The game starts amazing. Steampunk. Awesomeness. The storyline is great, and I loved it. Then, after 15 minutes or so it turns from an adventure game into a FPS. Awesome! Unfortunately, it went downhill from there. The graphics are amazing, but the FPS element sucks. I kept on playing it because it was intriguing, but it kept on getting more and more boring. 

I did finish the game. The ending can only be described with one acronym: WTF!? 

I bought the game heavily discounted, and at 15 dollars or so it’s worth it. I would have been disappointed at 60 bucks.

Can I recommend it? Not sure. If you can pick it up for cheap; go ahead. Else, mehh.
身经百战的我玩这个居然有3D眩晕，玩一个小时就得停下来歇会。

this is by far the best one of all the bio shock seriesl .....sorry no spoilers.
i can only say you wont't be disappointed.

By far one of the top 20 games i have played in my life..... maybe even the top 10

Ben bu kadar mükemmel bir oyun oynamadım. Bioshock 1 ve 2 yi gerilim oyunu diye oynamamıştım, bunu da böyle sanıyordum ve bi arkadaşın desteklemesi üzerine indirdim(çakma) gerçekten muazzam bir hikayesi ve tabiki kendine hayran bıraktıran Elizabeth'i ile kendine çekiyor. 
Sonra da gelip bu oyunu yapanlara kesinlikle hakkını vermeliyim dedim ve bütün ek paketleriyle satın aldım, zerre pişman değilim.

Bu arada finali biraz ağırdır anlayamaya bilirsiniz normaldir yardım edebilirim :D
Türkçe yaması da internette mevcuttur indirip kullanabilirsiniz...

--Spoiler--
[spoiler]Arkadaş oyun 2 dlc si ile toplam 3 kere bitiyo, 3'ünde de kötü bitiyor amk :( [/spoiler]

[b]Premessa[/b]
Nonostante non abbia una trama proprio collegata ai primi due Bioshock, consiglio vivamente di partire col giocare proprio con i primi due capitoli della saga.
[b]La Trama[/b]
Noi vestiremo i panni di Booker De Witt, un uomo che dovrà saldare il proprio debito con delle persone molto influenti ed è proprio per questo che lui verrà inviato nella città sospesa di Columbia. Qui ci troveremo davanti a molte insidie e ci saranno molti colpi di scena durante la nostra avventura.
[b]Il Gameplay[/b]
L'ho trovato molto fluido e divertente, non ci si annoia mai. Hanno aggiunto anche il sistema del mirino e il sistema del salto che se non vado errato non c'era nei precedenti capitoli. L'IA nemica è molto sviluppata e vi darà filo da torcere. Stessa cosa per l'IA alleata dove la vostra compagna di viaggio Elizabeth sembra una persona vera in carne ed ossa e vi aiuterà trovandovi armi, munizioni e medikit. Diciamo che comunque rispecchia molto lo stile dei passati Bioschock però migliorandoli notevolmente.
[b]La Grafica[/b]
E' veramente bellissima! Già era molto bella la grafica della Rapture sottomarina e con questo si sono superati, soprattutto con i movimenti facciali di Elizabeth.
[b]L'ambientazione[/b]
Columbia è veramente una città fantastica e creata benissimo. Se non l'avete già capito si tratta di una città sospesa nel cielo. Quindi si cambia totalmente dai capitoli precedenti che erano ambientati sott'acqua. Si potranno vedere anche molte differenze in questa città come per esempio i vari quartieri. Infatti si potranno contraddistinguere i quartieri poveri, ricchi e industriali. Inoltre si potranno vedere le persone passeggiare e parlare tranquillamente, come in una città vera.
[b]L'equipaggiamento[/b]
Saremo dotati dei soliti "superpoteri" come nei precedenti capitoli con la differenza che ce ne saranno molti di più (es: incenerimento, scossa elettrica, super-spinta e lanciare orde di corvi che divoreranno i vostri nemici). Inoltre potremmo utilizzare anche armi come pistola, mitra e fucile a pompa.
[b]La Durata[/b]
Io sono riuscito a finirlo in circa 8 ore.
[b]Il Doppiaggio[/b]
Il doppiaggio mi è piaciuto veramente molto e l'ho trovato azzeccatissimo con il carattere e le personalità dei personaggi.
VOTO FINALE: 90/100

This is by far one of my favorite games of all time. I bought this game for PS3 and now recently purcahsed the game via Steam. Infinite is rich in story and world immersion. It has gripping action and a jaw dropping plot twist. It's games like these that I wish there were more of in this world, a profound thriller that makes you question the bigger picture while dunking you into a beautiful and detailed world.

"No, but I'm afraid of you!"
i love it:)

Just a great game overall!   Paid $9.89 for it and know that I've played it, I would value it around $50.   Well balanced fighting to exploring ratio in an open-world environment.   Haven't experienced any glitches.   Plot is phenomenal with a history crash course of how America became "great" by stepping on the necks of other races and cultures.   You can just tell that the designers put alot of thought into this project.   I also found the body language of the characters to be believable.   Most games just keep the characters expression the same, but you can tell that the characters expressions change with situation which makes for a more realistic game.

:p
结局那么惨真的好吗。。。。
'Tis one of those games which makes you cry like a little b*tch while tearing your brain a new one.
ซื้อเเพ็คคุ้มจัง

BioShock Infinite is an absolutely amazing game. From the graphics to the story. It really is an experience to play this game.

The game is on the shorter side, but the story is so good it really makes up for it. The twist and turns of the plot keep you on the edge of your seat the whole time. The combat system is a little repeatitive but does get significantly harder as you go on.

There is a small section of the game where it's kinda like a horror game, but it's mostly a tribute to BioShock 1's horror feel to the game.

Getting this during a sale is the best idea even tho I would recommend it at full price to. Piece of advice, get your mind ready for the story. It's better than most movies.
这种游戏根本不能通关，通关后就感觉身体被掏空
전투할때 총알이 떨어지거나 소금이 부족하면 중간 중간 혹은 전투 도중에 돈,탄약,소금을 찾아 전해주는 엘리자베스라는 이름을 가진 아름다운 천사를 볼수 있습니다.

BioShock Infinite is basically a spin-off prequel to the main BioShock games, because it takes place before the main games and are loosely related. It still has similar themes, like the rulers vs the oppressed taking place in a beautiful but war-torn city in a strange location. We play as Booker DeWitt, a bounty hunter whose task is to bring back the mysterious Elizabeth, a young woman who can open portals to other worlds.

The fighting combines unique retro-styled weapons and superpower-like Vigors, which are the equivalent of Plasmids from previous games. Sadly, we cannot keep many weapons, we can only carry 2 as opposed to the previous games where we can carry everything. You can still have all Vigors, though. There are no melee weapons, but Booker can punch and execute enemies with his Sky-Hook.

The game's artstyle is its strong point. The colorful, steampunk-inspired levels are beautiful, and combined with a unique cartoon-like artstyle. Sadly, there isn't really enough time to enjoy since most of the game is like a fast-paced FPS and it changes from idyllic to war-torn pretty quick. Personally, I would've loved if there were less combat and the war started much later.

The biggest flaw of this game and the DLCs is the saving system. There is chapter select, but all the chapters are basically autosaves from your latest playthrough. So if you play on the hardest difficulty and one day want to play a chapter on an easier difficulty, you'll have to replay from start. There are also no quicksaves or manual saves. It's a major flaw on such a great game, and I hope no other devs will follow this saving method.

BioShock Infinite was one of the earlier games I played on Steam, and re-writing this review almost 5 years later, the opening is just as beautiful as when I played it the first time. If you want a chronological playthrough, start your BioShock journey with Infinite and the DLCs.
好玩好玩！我把它当成古墓玩了，边收集边任务，一直让艾丽莎白等我xd。还有点恐怖氛围，里面居然有义和团扶清灭洋什么鬼？我大清亡啦？

Gran historia y una entretenida jugabilidad que junto con panteón marino (DLC) forma un final que logra llenar todas mis expectativas. Un muy buen cierre por parte de irrational games para con esta eminente franquicia. Altamente recomendado.

"Press F to comfort Elizabeth"

I am really on the fence about this game. I liked it overall, but I find it hard to see past it's major flaws. On one hand it's an insanely polished, slick and smooth AAA shooter with amazing visuals. On the other, it's hand-holding, repetitive and casual one with all the tropes and cliches of any shooter made within the last 10 years.

The gameplay and shooting are great. It feels awesome shooting enemies, but later on they become bullet sponges to the extreme. The reused environments don't help this at all and I could predict easily when a fight is about to break out. Fighting in the same arena three times so I can progress past some artificial boundry is just dumb. Combat is not challenging at all, there is nearly no penalty for death other than losing a bit of cash. If you die, you're right back into it almost instantaneously (with extra ammo to boot.) With no penalty for death all tension is lost and gunfights become boring. This game needs a harder diffculty with better AI that doesn't just increase enemy health. Playing on hard is barely a challenge.

 The only time this game shows any semblance of difficulty is when you are tossed into an arena crawling with bullet sponges and no ammo for your weapons. (Which happens more than it should and I doubt that  was fully intended.) A dedicated weapon stand would have helped this issue. Most of my deaths came from handymen who are the biggest bullet sponges of them all and sometimes the game doesn't provide you with the necessary cover/space to evade their cheetah speed attacks. Deaths from these guys always felt cheap to me.

(UPDATE:) There is a HUGE diffculty spike in the last hour or so of the game. What the hell? I've never seen anything quite like this. Nine hours of straight easy, then you have to defend an airship from hundreds of attackers. It was quite jarring being to be honest, but a welcome challenge.) It's almost as if the devs are trying to extend the life of the game as far as they can by making the last stage so much more difficult. It sticks out like a sore thumb.

The power ups and weapons are fun, but most of them are redundant. You can beat the whole game easily by using the carbine and shock jockey almost exclusively. The sniper rifle is too good when it's fully upgraded. Just shock everyone and shoot them in the head. The weapon upgrades are fine, but I hated how some of them are artificially locked until you progress further, it just feels like another linear element put in to give the player the illusion of choice.

This game also suffers from the same thing any game does that tells a linear story. There are far too many scripted parts that take control away from the character. I was stuck in one part for nearly 10 minutes because I wasn't looking at a book the right way to trigger a short cutscene. This game pretty much plays itself when you aren't in one of the many shooting gallerys. Some puzzles or other mechanics would really help to break up the monotony of the endless shooting.

The story itself is okay, but nothing really groundbreaking. It's very predictable at times and could really use a better villain with more "screen time." It also seems to drag on way too long, I actually was hoping it would end a couple of times (which is never a good thing.) I'll keep this spoiler free, so I won't go any further. 

I can see the appeal of this game and there are parts I really liked in it. It seems I've played far too many linear action fps games ike it in the last decade to fully enjoy it. Maybe I am just spoiled. I'd give it a half thumbs up if I could.

6.5/10

bioshock infinite 
เนื้อเรื่อง ทำออกมาได้ดีมากๆ ถ้าอยากรู้ก็ไปเล่นเอาเอง(เเต่จุดเด่นหลักๆก็อยู่ที่เนื้อเรื่องนี่เเหละ) gameplay เป็นเกม fps ที่ทำออกมาได้สนุกอยู่นะ มีปืนที่หลากหลายเเถมยังมีพลังเวทมนต์ให้ใช้ผสมผสานกับปืนได้ด้วย เเละก็มีอีกความสามรถพิเศษที่จะได้มาก็คือระบบ gear จะช่วยเพิ่มความติดตัวให้อย่างเช่น ถ้าถูกยิงจะเพิ่มความเร็วในการเคลื่อนที่ให้เราไรเงี้ย เเละเราก็สามารถ upgrade พวกปืนเเละก็พลังพิเศษเราได้อีกหนะ  ที่รองลงมาจากเนื้อเรื่องก็คงเป็นฉากนี่เเหละ คือ ฉากทำออกมาได้เจ๋งมากๆ+กับดนตรีที่โครตจะ classic มันเป็นอะไรที่ลงตัวเเละเข้ากันสุดๆ ai การเเสดงท่าทางทำออกมาก็ดีอยู่อะบางจุดทำออกมาได้เเข็งๆไปนิดเเต่ก็ ok นะ สปอยนิดนึงเเล้วกันมันคันมือ คือตัวเราต้องลักพาตัวเด็กผู้หญิงที่ชื่อ elizabeth ออกจากเมืองลอยฟ้าเพื่อปลดหนี้สิน ซึ่ง elizabeth ก็จะเป็นเหมือนคู่หูตลอดกาลของเรา ด้วยพลังของเธอ เธอจะคอยส่งของมาให้เราตลอดเวลา ตั้งเเต่อาวุธยันไม้จิ้มฟันเลยทีเดียว คือช่วยมาไม่เสียหลายเเน่นอน ตลอดเวลาที่อยู่กับเธอคุณจะไม่รู้สึกเหมือนอยู่กับ ai หรือว่า bot เลย คุณจะรู้สึกถึงเด็กสาวที่ซุกซนเเล้วก็มีความรู้สึกที่หลากหลาย ไม่ว่าจะเป็น ตื่นเต้น โกรธ เสียใจ ถือว่าทีมงานที่ออกเเบบตัวละครทำออกได้ตั้งใจสุดๆนับถือเลย ถือว่าเป็นประสบการณ์ในการเล่นที่ดีมากๆเลย 
ข้อเสีย:ก็คงเป็นไม่มีระบบ Multiplayer หละมั้งเเต่ก็ไม่เป็นปัญหาเท่าไหร่ ส่วนใครที่เป็นพวกไม่ถูกกับเกมที่ต้องโลดโผนหรือเกมเร็วก็ไม่ค่อยเเนะนำเท่าไหร่
#สรุปเลยเเล้วกัน BioShock Infinite เป็นเกมที่มีเนื้อเรื่องที่ดีเเละระบบgameplayที่มันใช้ได้ เป็นเกมที่คู่ควรกับการซื้ออย่างที่สุด ซื้อมาไม่ผิดหวังเเน่นอน

Great game. Just don't go into this anticipating something attatched to the former two Bioshock games. Rapture does not play a factor in this story at all, not even as a prequel. Which is frustrating. It feels much more like an anthology story with its own world that just so happens to be attached to the Bioshock game title. Remove the Bioshock name and this game honestly could have done perfectly well standing on its own. I am not sure about you, but that frustrates me a bit, since I feel like Rapture could offer a great deal more storytelling. The 'look' and 'feel' of Infinite is so wildly different from the previous two... It really does not feel appropriate to label it as 'Bioshock'. Instead it's more like 'Bioshock if everything was changed completely and also there's wormholes in space and time'.


Still... That being said. It's a great game. Great graphics, great voice acting, great story and gameplay. I do recommend it overall. But it does not feel satisfying to call it a 'Bioshock' game.


*Update, for clarification and a mild spoiler. I've played the whole game, and the DLC. 2 seconds spent in Rapture at the very end of the game still doesn't grant this much credit under the Bioshock title. And DLC shouldn't be where a game is made relevant to its title series.

I don't hate this game in the slightest but there were some very odd choices made here.

Ostatni poziom przechodziłem używając jednej ręki ponieważ drugą zbierałem szczękę z podłogi.

Nie będę się rozpisywał o świetnej grafice i wartkiej akcji dobrze zrealizowanej strzelanki fabularnej, jaką jest Bioshock Infinite - to można zobaczyć na pierwszym lepszym trailerze. Za to zwrócę uwagę na coś, czego żaden zwiastun nie jest w stanie oddać.
Nie znam innej gry, która miałaby tak doskonale zaprojektowaną i wprowadzoną w życie mechanikę gry, która powoduje, że Elizabeth jest nie tylko NPCem plączącym się pod nogami, ale żywym towarzyszem na którego liczymy, i z którym wchodzimy w bardzo głęboką relację - my gracze. Nie obserwujemy z oddali historii głównego bahatera, ale utożsamiamy się z nim. Nie obserwujemy jego relacji z innymi, ale sami angażujemy się emocjonalnie w związki z wiarygodnymi bohaterami.

Ta gra ma tak dobrą fabułę, że chcesz przejść ją jak naszybciej, żeby dowiedzieć się jak to wszystko się skończy i jednocześnie tak wspaniały świat i bohaterów, że gdy wszystko już się skończy wpatrujesz się w napisy końcowe zastanawiając się co zrobić ze swoim życiem.

This is an amazing game with a very good story.
I've finished the game on PS3 and I'm going to finish the story with all it's DLC from the Bioshock Collection I bought from the sale. 
The game is well optimized, I have a GTX 750 Ti with settings on almost all Ultra and I never go below 60 FPS unless it's stutter, I'd say the stutters are Uncommon because they dont have it often and they dont happen rarely.

The only problem I have with this game is it's FOV slider. If you dont have motion sickness like me, this wouldnt be a problem for you. In my opinion, the max FOV isnt enough for me not to get dizzy.
10/10 would invest more time in lore

我真的是非常喜欢这款游戏，虽然我在D版上已经通关三遍了，但是这款游戏带给我的震撼感依然不变。所以，打折的时候请不要犹豫，这款游戏能带给你的震撼感远比你想象的多。

Great game. Yes, it is not the game of the early trailers which is unfortunate but the end product is still overall pretty good. The story is definitely one of the best I have encountered, better than the original Bioshock in some regards. My main complaint is the combat can feel pretty dull and repetitive. There's vigors (same as plasmids basically) but they don't really seem to be as useful in combat as they were in Bioshock 1 & 2. You can absolutely beat the game without using them so I wish they felt more useful. The same can be said about the gear you collect, I didn't use but maybe a quarter of it. I don't mind linear games but I prefer games where strategy is key to progressing through the levels and I felt like most of the time I could just run and gun and still win without much difficulty. I played through on normal difficulty and nothing proved especially challenging. I may play through again on the max difficulty to see if it's any better. 

I had this game in my library for 3 years, glad I finally had time to play it.
WOW! didnt see that coming... One of the best games have played in a long time.

Pros
-Amazing story
-good graphics for when its released
-alternate reality done really well
-no annoying mechanics (companion isn't a useless sack of meat, no grinding for a drop, etc.)

Cons
-combat is bland and repetitive (basic gun fights w/ magic, sky-lines part interesting but not used too often)
-confusing to understand story at first

Best Companion: Elizabeth.
Doesn't get in the way. Check.
Doesn't die. Check.
Gives you ammo. Check.
Gives you health. Check.
Gives you salt. Check.
Could lockpick. Check.
Enemy ignores her. Check.
She's also pretty damn ho....*ahem*...well-designed.

Elizabeth 11/10
The story is pretty good too.

I would say that this game is an essential game that every person that cares about good gameplay and amazing story should play. I would put it at the level of Half Life in those aspects. I mostly bought the game for the story and the style/graphics but I would say that if you are a fan of FPS games then this is also a game for you. I know I am a little late and all with playing this game, but if you are reading this review I would argue that you are too so u can't get me there. I would definitely put this as a must play, but everyone has their own opinion. I will also answer the most crucial question: Do you have to play the previous 2 games to understand the story? The answer is a simple no, although I would recommend either reading up on the story or watching some story videos on YouTube if you are interested. I would give this a 10/10 even though I haven’t finished the game if it wasn't for one thing. This game shamelessly promotes doing bathsalts and accepting drinks from strangers in a way that worries me, however this can be overlooked by pretending that you are some magical superman person, but I don't like fooling myself and accepted this unfortunate decision for what it is. I think that anyone that thinks about playing this game so long after it's relevancy in the gaming community definitely should. This game hasn't died and it's one hellofa beautiful ride!
